description: 18th century. Perhaps borrowed from Mandingo cano, or from a language of the East Indies.

entries.meaning: A botanical gum produced by various trees and other plants, particularly bloodwood species of eucalypts (Angophora, Corymbia, Eucalyptus), Butea, and Pterocarpus, used in tanning and dyeing and as an astringent in medicine.

description: From Russian кино (kino), via Kino-Eye and Dziga Vertov's identification of his film Man with a Movie Camera as "ABSOLUTE KINOGRAPHY".

adjectives.description: kino (comparative more kino, superlative most kino)

entries.meaning: (Internet slang, 4chan slang) Grand, cinematic, especially in regards to cinema or other cultural mediums.
(Internet slang, 4chan slang) Especially good or sophisticated cinema.

description: Coined by Ross Jeffries, from kinesthesia.

entries.meaning: (seduction community) Physical contact with another person, touch.
